definition: to leak (of water or gas)/to drip/to drain/to discharge/to leak out/to divulge (secrets)/to give vent (to anger, spite etc)/to disperse/to reduce

sentences.english: Acquire for this need additional backup disk drive, in case the discharge outside data.
sentences.chinese: 爲此需要添置額外備份磁碟機，以防數據外泄。

sentences.english: Pathogenic fire-heat tends to consume the body fluid and leads to deficiency of it.
sentences.chinese: 火熱之邪最易迫津外泄，耗傷人體陰液。

sentences.english: They implemented a sandbox to prevent that exfiltration of data from happening.
sentences.chinese: 他們實現了一個沙箱來防止這種數據外泄的發生。

sentences.english: The workers are unblocking the sewer to prevent the leakage of dirty water.
sentences.chinese: 工人們正在疏通下水管道，防止髒水外泄。

sentences.english: The memory profiling report can show many memory leaks.
sentences.chinese: 內存文件報告可以向您展示許多內存外泄。

sentences.english: 4 today is still covered by the concrete cover called the 'sarcophagus' which was hastily improvised to stem the outflow of radiation.
sentences.chinese: 石棺是在搶險時倉促建成，用以遏制輻射外泄。

sentences.english: To keep the scandal from coming out, the politician paid a lot of hush money .
sentences.chinese: 爲了防止醜聞外泄，政客付出大筆的封口費。

sentences.english: Security section became aware of the breach and performed their function.
sentences.chinese: 安全部門注意到信息的外泄並履行了他們的職責。

sentences.english: Anyone who has ever pumped their own gas downwind of the tank knows the tell-tale smell of fuel.
sentences.chinese: 在下風口加過油的人都知道汽油外泄的那種味道。

definition: (of a liquid or gas) to leak/to divulge (a secret)/to leak
to leak out/to release (liquid or gas)
to leak (of water or gas)/to drip/to drain/to discharge/to leak out/to divulge (secrets)/to give vent (to anger, spite etc)/to disperse/to reduce
to make (military) incursions/to invade/to intrude into/to trespass/to gain unauthorized access (computing)
to leak (of information, liquid etc)/to divulge
to steal (including identity theft, credit card fraud or theft of computer account)/to misappropriate
to sense/to perceive/to become aware of/to detect
to expose (to the air, light etc)/to leave uncovered/exposure
to keep sth confidential/to maintain secrecy
